rComments: Slideshows are very long and he usually doesn't finish (probably because of his irrelevant tangents about the history behind each theorem), forcing us to do the rest of the lecture on our own time. Barely shows steps for each calculation and assumes everything is common knowledge despite our only stats experience being from a single intro course.
Not difficult to understand the content, but a bit much calculations

Recommend Dr. Xuhua's class to those interested in molecular phylogeny, great detail explaining the fundamental principles of molecular phylogenetics and the current methods used in this field. Expect to rewatch the lecture slides to have a good understanding of the material being taught. Exams were based on practical applications of the methods.

Professor Xia has easily been one of the kindest and funniest professors I have taken in my 3 years of undergrad. His exams are very straightforward and often come from class examples. Despite some reviews claiming that he doesn't provide explanations to course content, I could not think of something farther from the truth. 10/10 recommend any day!

This is one of those courses where your effort = your grade. If you're willing to do the work, and try to understand the material *you will* get a good grade. The professor is kind, extremely knowledgeable and easily approachable. 
If you are interested in bioinformatics, uottawa does not have a better professor.

He refused to do his job as a prof and explain/help with obscure course content. Exams were easy, though, except that one question that he did not teach and had to send the formula via email the day of the exam. He also sent out sarcastic replies in response to questions, like "this is just high school math".

Lectures are very, very long and only a fraction of it (just maths) makes it into the exams. Meanwhile, the prof was MIA during the entire semester and offers sarcastic/snarky replies when questions were asked via email. The only time you could meet him face to face was for a review session in the end. Exams were fun, though, and fair.

Had to devote a lot of time into this course but it was manageable. He is a good prof and clearly very knowledgeable but sometimes hard to understand. Keep up with the class and do the weekly homework and you will be fine. Final was reflective of the in-slide homework.

This course is a really hard biology course. I really wanted to give up at the beginning but thank god I didn't. The beginning material make sense as it proceeds towards the end of the class. Simple mathematics skills are required to gain success. All exam questions are taken from slides so no surprises on the excel exams. Overall: recommended.

A lot of the important information is hidden within the audio recordings so you need to REALLY pay attention to the additional info he provides. The exams are excel files and really tedious if you're not tech-savvy. Theoretical & comprehension content is never discussed on the exams. Overall, if you're not a math-person, I do not recommend.

easy A. Recorded powerpoint audio lectures are always hard to focus on, and Dr Xias were the same - but it was an easy class even if you didnt pay full attention. Grades came from take home assignments and a take home exam that were not difficult if you refer to the PowerPoints he provided. He explains all the excel functions you need

The course was straightforward if you listen to his lectures. I enjoyed the stories and expanded knowledge taught in class. As a below-average student, I had to work for the mark but it isn't impossible to get a decent grade and retain information if you're engaged. This works in other courses too, you'll be dying but then you breathe again :)
This class was very easy. Just listen to the lecture . Its literally just assignments every week and a take home exam. people will complain about anything, this couldve been so much harder

I took population genetics online during the COVID-19 pandemic and found his lectures overwhelming dry and struggled to attend any of them. However, I did really well in the course because he had no tests- only assignments. He doesn't speak English very well so you may need to replay his lectures a few times- also his emails didn't make sense

The final was brutal it was a 3 day excel exam with 8 questions of 10-14 point with no part marks given if you messed up despite saying it was possible their criteria for qualifying is stricter than in MAT1330/1332. They give no feedback or solutions to anything slide assignments sometimes were given just answers also unofficial MAT2379 prereq

I'm glad I took this class with Prof. Xia. His slides are very good and the weekly assignments are extremely simple. Problem sets every few weeks aren't that bad either. I also don't think he realizes how funny he actually is. Very nice prof too!

Awesome prof, would definitely take again. Doesn't hammer on the details, wants you to know the major ideas behind the lectures. Gives sample questions for the exams which are extremely helpful. If you can take him 1000000% recommend. You won't regret it.

He is clearly very smart and passionate, the material itself is straight forward, and the tests are very fair, but his lectures are really confusing and hard to follow. He expects you have a solid background in statistics (which makes things hard), and i wish he'd put everything important on the slides bc if you miss what he says you're screwed

The lectures overall can be confusing and seem a bit aimless, but the topics that are necessary to know for evaluation are clearly emphasized. If you pay attention, Dr. Xia's classes are fairly easy to do well on with much less effort than the vast majority of biology classes. He is also very receptive to questions and is quite helpful.

Go to the lectures as he clearly explains what is important. I took this as my science elective and it was definitely the best decision. It required less work than my mandatory courses and the practice problems helped immensely.
Lectures were very interesting and easy to take notes on. Do the practice questions they're so helpful for the midterms.

Professor Xia fails to clearly communicate all the clear knowledge he possess to the students. I sometimes feel he just expects the students to understand a concept although his explanations are all over the place. He talks to quick and fails to really engage his audience and he consistently recycles his slide from last year not adding anything new

ASK QUESTIONS if you don't understand. Prof Xia is very helpful, but does move fast during the course, assuming you have the skills required to apply the mathematical concepts correctly without going step-by-step in class. The textbook is USELESS for explaining anything. Slides are quite busy, but study what he tells you to! Overall, v recommended!
Great prof

My best advice would be to go into this class with a relaxed approach. Review major concepts after every class, but dont fret the details: he doesn't test them. If you mess up the major concepts, you lose lots of marks on the test. People that complain here didn't understand key learning goals that he hinted at throughout the course.

I'll be honest, I didn't do well on the first midterm, but once I went to talk to him he was really helpful in explaining concepts. His review sessions also help clear up what the main focus will be on the tests. Make sure to take good notes in class as the slides can be confusing without explanation.
teacherRatingTags: ['Gives good feedback', 'Graded by few things', 'Accessible outside class']

rComments: Would not take again. He cares about us, he wants us to do well, he gives lots of hints about the exams, granted. I just cannot get over the extremely short midterms and no marks for showing your work. The slides are also TERRIBLE. If this class is mandatory, go to the review classes and don't punch the wrong button in your calculator

His slides seem chaotic/all over the place, so if you skip class it's really difficult to figure out what is important and what is not. He is available to help during office hours and was really helpful if you didn't understand what he was saying during lectures. He holds review sessions before exams, which definitely saved me at least once!

Nice prof, but emails the entire class to complain about bad reviews on this site. In a fairness, didn't know what direction he was trying to go with when teaching, but reading the textbook chapters got me an A.

The course material is very bland. The professor explains the content well, but has an accent which made it a bit difficult for me to understand (but English is also my second language so that factors into it). The exams are very short (final was 4 pg) but it is easy to do well if you pay attention in lectures and review the content.

Wonderful class! It was mandatory for me, however I would have taken it regardless. The material is very interesting, applications based and easy, but you still have to put in effort! A lot of people did not do very well simply because they assumed they didnt have to study/review it too much. The prof loves to help in any way he can. I recommend.

Dr. Xia is a very knowledgable professor. He is also very hard working and friendly. In order to succeed in his course, you have to study hard and ask questions. In all honestly, I learnt more with Dr. Xia than any other prof in my undergrad. He teaches his students to be more independent and appreciate research in the science field.

Dr. Xia is an awesome prof! This was the first class I took with respect to Molecular genetics and I'm loving it. He keeps the class interesting by giving us background and providing real world application, which is extremely helpful for all us newbies to the field. His midterms are also very fair, study what he tells you to, and you're golden!!

Dr. Xia is a great professor and one of my favourite. It was a pleasure taking his course. He is really passionate about what he teaches and is very knowledgeable in it. He has an accent but you get used to it and it's not as bad as other people make it out to be. He is really wise and I have great respect for him. Fantastic professor

Very hard to understand. don't expect yourself to get used to his pronunciation, drop the course if you still don't get it after the or four course, cause it will not get better. Not very helpful in class, but if you have the old stuff from previous years (notes...) it may be helpful, cause following him in class is confusing!

I am well acquainted with this professor, especially out of class. He has a mild accent but I may have just gotten used to it. Is very nice and you can talk to him expecting a good answer. His course is pretty hard, however, what's the point of an easy course? You're there to learn.

Found this prof really confusing to follow and a little bit scattered. All you need is the info in the course pack though, which made my lack of following him in lecture a little less concerning. Good luck! This course was tough.
Awesome guy. Loves and knows his stuff. Accent can be a bit confusing at first, but you get used to it pretty quickly. Makes it easy to understand. Fair questions on exams.
I think he is really nice and he knows his stuff. He is awesome.
Amazing prof! I don't think I've had a more helpful prof! Course isn't the easiest course in the world, but definitely makes the material a lot easier!

Why is so many people hating on him? although it may be hard to understand him at times, he knows what he's teaching. for the people who gave him low ratings, its just cause you slacked. dont blame it on the prof

Prof Xia is one of the best Profs I've had. He's a genius and hilarious to boot. I had no problems understanding him. I saw Dr. Xia many times outside class and each time he was extremely helpful, and nice. One thing though, he's not very tolerant when it comes to stupidity/incompetence so beware.
No Comments
No Comments

Listen. Xia is not a horrible teacher by any means. He is very funny and he tried his best to convey the subject matter well. A problem was that the expectations for the class were NOT clear and more examples of what kind of questions he would ask should have been given. The marking of the labs was unfair. The midterms should have been returned

Professor Xia is hillarious, give him a break, you can go talk to him anytime, so use it he's a really nice guy! And REALLY FUNNY! His TA's were also VERY helpful this year, hope he keeps the same ones next year!
Worst prof ever!  Sorry dude, but we don't undertand a word you're saying...  From Day 1 up to the final, I had no idea of what to expect!  Labs are horrible too!
No Comments
Difficult to understand at first, but obviously knows what he is talking about.
I absolutely agree with the above comment.  He changed the marking scheme *AFTER* the final exam!!  WTH??!!!!

One of the worst classes I have ever taken.  I expected far more from a 4th year class.  You are given NO expectation of what is expected until it is too late (i.e. AFTER assignments or exams are written).  I was given more respect in 1st year classes!
